intro: Rooksbya euphorbioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in a cup-like structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often covered in a sticky, latex-like substance, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family.
